An Interactive Fitting Tool for Differential Scanning Fluorimetry

Use the Radio button groups on the left side of the page to select between 96- and 384-well plate formats and to indicate whether the data is organized by row (i.e. A1, A2, ..., H11, H12) or by column (i.e. A1, B1, ..., G12, H12). Enter values in the text boxes to set initial values for Boltzmann sigmoid fit parameters and press the white buttons to fix them during curve fitting. Press the red button to re-fit all samples with updated Boltzmann sigmoid parameter settings.

Interact with the range slider below the residuals plot to optimize the temperature range used for curve fitting. Use the figure tools at the upper right of each plot to pan
, wheel zoom
, refresh each plot
, download plot to image file
, hover over the squares on the plate heatmap to see sample information
, and click on the plate heatmap or melting temperature table to select a new sample to fit
.


Click the green button to upload data files of your own. Click the blue buttons to download the melting temperature table to a csv file or save it to the clipboard.

(Note: input data must be in csv format and is expected to be in columns with headings containing sample identifiers. Some special characters may not be supported and could cause an error during file upload.)
